website_summaries.verdict: Although it's not so intuitive to navigate, the slim and comfortable Vivosmart 3 is a very good activity tracker that's waterproof and feature-packed.
pros: The Garmin Vivosmart 3 is slim, very comfortable to wear, has a built-in heart-rate monitor and is fully waterproof
It's loaded with extra features, including stress-level measurements, VO2 Max readings, and a rep counter
It shows notifications from your phone
cons: Some of the features are a little difficult to access on the watch
the display isn't as sharp as some competing models' displays

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made  NOT RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: The image is the SECOND Vivosmart 3 that I have had the strap simply snap while wearing. The first failed after 3 weeks of normal use (as in 66 yo retiree with sedentary lifestyle) . Extended "warranty" is worthless as this only kicks in AFTER the manufacturer's warranty so I had to go thru the legwork of warranty paperwork. At this point I want my money back ("Good luck with that, pal!"). This thing should never have been sold by Amazon. Period.
customer_reviews.author: cjnovack

customer_reviews.title: Watch stopped connecting to Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: The sleep monitoring function is a little flaky. If the watch battery goes low you will need to manually re-enter your sleep time. It seems like I have to adjust my sleep time every day after syncing with my cell phone in order to get my sleep cycle read out. The main screen functions are too sensitive and I end up in sub-menus quickly and then have to scroll back to the main screen. Update: 11/25/17. Vivvosmart 3 stopped connecting to my Bluetooth. Tried everything and I know how to work with software. I can sync through the computer but who wants to do that!
customer_reviews.author: PHOTOMAN225

customer_reviews.title: I don't like this at all
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this at all. It's always vibrating when i walk away from my phone saying that the blue tooth is no longer connected. so if you do a workout class and your phone is in the locker, you're getting a bunch of vibrating notifications when you go in and out of range. it also vibrates when the "move bar" clears. i don't need to be notified when i start to walk! big waste. UPDATE: band broke after 3 months of use. DO NOT BUY!! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE. Thank you Garmin!
customer_reviews.text: It may be too soon, I've had it about a week but so far I truly love it. I like how light and slim it is as well as accurate with all that it does and tracks. I don't mind the blur if that make it waterproof. I haven't soaked it yet just because I'm to used to taking it off (previous was a garmin vivosmart hR+) this is my favorite watch thus far. In picture I'm showing difference between my precious garmin and this one.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great tracker overall.
customer_reviews.text: I have found this to be a really good tracker and pretty accurate. It works well in syncing with other apps. The only reason for 4 stars is that sometimed it tracks some activities poorly. Stair climbing is a real problem. For the important measurements like steps, sleep and heart rate it works great. The app sets challenges for me and that seems to help me in terms of moving around more than I did before getting the tracker. I would definitely recommend this for all exercise levels.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Lempert

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend buying this. I previously owned a fit bit which I loved but they would quit working after a year or so. Fit bit was easy to use and sync. Garmin is hard to sync and I have to hit it on my wrist 3-4 times before the time or steps will light up.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: good waterproof fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin vivosmart3 seemswork well. My biggest complaint or rather cautionary statement is that steps are not tracked if you're arm Is stationary (pushing a shopping cart). But, beyond that the tracker is water proof for most water excursions which is a huge bonus, it is lower profile than most trackers and has a heart rate monitor. I love the face. It's not flashy at all so it isn't distracting. I approve.
customer_reviews.author: R Mc

customer_reviews.title: Screen won’t stay on
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving only one star because I truly dislike the feature of having to lift my arm in order to see the screen. I not only have to lift my arm I have to give it a little shake. It’s annoying and throws off my form when I’m running. I had an older version of this watch which was great, the screen was always on, I could glance at it when running to see my time and miles. It would’ve been ok if I could change the screen on time, but I can’t change it to be always on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of parameters that I wanted to record for my workout. Those parameters are Avg HR, Max HR, Total Calories, & Time of Activity. The Vivosmart 3 recorded these workout parameters. The reason I did not rate it a 5 is because I cannot review all of the parameters after the workout. I could review all of them after sharing the completed workout later using the Connect AP on my smartphone. I have not yet determined whether I could pull the complete activity from Connect or not for archiving.
customer_reviews.author: G. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Going on my third one in less than two years.
customer_reviews.text: Great tracker for me. It's accurate in regards to my stride, distance, and heart rate. The weight lifting app sucks though. However the build quality of the band is atrocious. The first band snapped in half in just under a year. The second band (the one I'm sending in for replacement today) is on the verge of snapping as well. If they would simply put the tracker in a better quality band (user serviceable) then this would be a 4-5 star tracker. I wouldn't recommend buying one unless you feel like sending it back for repair/replacement of the band once a year.
customer_reviews.author: C. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Strap is not durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a Vivosmart 3 for about a year now, and i’ve gone through 5 of them. One original that I bought, and 4 replacements. The strap keeps failing on the underside of the device, near the charging contacts. The electronics still work, the tracking is still fine, but the non-replaceable strap doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.author: C. Higham

customer_reviews.title: My new fitness pal watch
customer_reviews.text: I just love this little watch. It was cheap and does everything I need. I haven’t had an issue with the band breaking, but I have been gentle with it when removing it because of other reviews. Also I am extremely sensitive to latex and I have not had any reaction to this band. It is very comfortable and doesn’t light up at night to disturb my sleep. This is so much better than the cheapo watches I have tried. The biggest benefit is the ability to sync my info with the MY FITNESS PAL app. This is huge!!
customer_reviews.author: texmommy

customer_reviews.title: Good middle-of-the-road fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this watch for a month and really enjoy it. Tracking my activities - both small and big - has helped with my motivation. I'm unsure how accurate the sleep monitoring is and question it's readings often. The app is easy to use, although I think there are aspects of it I don't use or know about. I have a very small wrist and the size of the band and watch fit perfect. I am worried about the band not being replaceable, but figured it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: OK - NOT AS ACCURATE AS I HAD HOPED
customer_reviews.text: This was fun for a little while although not really very accurate. I purchased it to monitor my heart rate while exercising. Although it wasn't great at this, I did learn some things about myself. For example, while I don't believe the watch can tell whether I am in deep or REM sleep, I do see that for the most part, I am getting enough good sleep. I also liked the challenge of meeting the step and stairs goals although I don't think they are exact, they are good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Loop for holding strap broke within a year. Created my own loop, but not nearly as good as Garmin's loop. Very little difference between lowest brightness setting and highest brightness setting. Challenging to read screen inside (work has LED overhead lighting) and impossible to read outside under partially sunny skies. Battery lasts reasonably well between charges. Placement on wrist has caused noticeable change in appearance of arm even after not wearing for a few days. It tracks helpful things. The workout settings that are preprogrammed in the mobile app are limited, especially with all the various popular workout moves that are currently available.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Seigfried

customer_reviews.title: Cool Tech That Works
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sweet! Tracks sleep, stress levels, heart rate. Connected to the phone, it keeps all that stored for review and comparison between days. The battery lasts around 5-6 days. Pairing is a bit of a challenge until you figure out the trick.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great features for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade from my previous Garmin Vivosmart HR which I wore for 2+ years and only replaced because the band fell apart. I like the more streamlined bracelet style of the Vivosmart 3 and the more detailed data it provides that is viewable in the Connect app. I chose Garmin originally over Fitbit because it is water resistant and I am a swimmer. It is a good value for the price, though I wish it had GPS. Only complaints - touch screen can be challenging when swiping to start an activity. Also annoying that the charger interface keeps changing, so that I could not use my old charger with the new band.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Schiller

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, just broke too quick for me to get any enjoyment out of it.
customer_reviews.text: I actually love this Fitbit more than I have any of the other one I purchased from amazon. My only problem with it is that after two months of wearing it the band broke and it make it unwearable. I tried to see if I could just replace the band or find a way to have it repaired but the way the watch is made I would have to purchase a new one. I am not in a position right now to do that so I am without one right now.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Brown

customer_reviews.title: Tried fitbit tackers/watches and they didn't seem to last especially with the crappy water rating
customer_reviews.text: Had two garmin watches before this one. Still use the forerunner but wanted something for all day wear. Tried fitbit tackers/watches and they didn't seem to last especially with the crappy water rating. Bought this one for that reason. The first week of using it, the watch was awesome. After a week of using it, the watch would shut off. Would have to plug it into the charging cable to turn it back on. Funny thing is the watch is not supposed to turn off. Battery is fully charged so that wasn't my issue. Emailed garmin a week ago and still no response from them. Crappy watch with a company that doesn't respond back.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Can wear in water/shower with it on, slimmer than Fitbit, pretty easy to use Cons: Can’t see in direct sunlight, sometimes doesn’t count activities accurately, doesn’t always turn on when you turn your wrist All pros and cons are what I found on review sites before I ordered. They were spot on for all of them
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: On Line manual & manual accompanying the Vivosmart 3 were not at all helpful
customer_reviews.text: I got the app and began to set it for pairing but the watch language had changed from ENto FR and altho I can manage french, the time was synchronized to France and nothing told me how to change that. I tried restarting but that did not allow me to change the language or time/date. I have to return this with out help.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Great device: good battery time
customer_reviews.text: Great device: good battery time, waterproof, accuracy, etc. BUT. The app software is really BAD. Does not really synch well. if you don’t have internet connection, forget about seeing your data; be prepared to wait forever even if you do; data are inconsistent as you try to navigate they them; Apple Health synch is often off. Most annoying: while it detects an activity quite well, it still requires you to enter it manually... why? Garmin has done a great job with the device: why is the app software so poor? I don’t get it.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Battistini

customer_reviews.title: Good smart watch, very weak build
customer_reviews.text: As far a fitness tracker goes it's good. Small on your wrist and easy to charge. But like other Garmin fitness watch straps the pin breaks way too easy. On day 3 while doing the trash (collapsing Amazon boxes) the pin on the strap broke and it was only because of the rubber wrist strap holder that I did not lose the watch altogether.
customer_reviews.author: RTV

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Like: Great at tracking sleep, heart rate, stress, steps, staircases and walks Small size on wrist Easy and quick to recharge Good Garmin Connect smartphone app interface (tho graph label readability is poor) Good price Room for improvement: Watch's touchscreen is really useless in water - so tracking swimming can be troublesome Watch functions are poor - eg I can't set a countdown timer that restarts itself automatically (eg to time 18 x 100m freestyle off 1'50") Auto-detects walks and runs but not cycling or swimming Integration with Strava is only for walks and runs and Strava can't match the integrated events with its own events
customer_reviews.author: Rob Finean

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily wear
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as expected, used everyday and works well. The connect app is helpful although I have not figured out all functions yet. One pet peeve is that, unless you are using the watch face that shows battery life, there is no way to check in on the device unless it warms you that its low. Overall great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Insiyah

customer_reviews.title: Great features, horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the smartphone functionality make it a must have Update: First one, the screen quit working, customer service was great, sent me a second one for free Second one, the band came broke at the glue joint. Didn't bother going through the whole warranty process again If you aren't active, this activity tracker will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Better than a FitBit
customer_reviews.text: I used a FitBit for many years. I switched to the Garmin after my husband, who is a Marathoner, started using this watch for his training. It is a more comfortable fit, cheaper price and more user friendly than the FitBit. I paid $50 less for my Garmin vivosmart 3.
customer_reviews.author: rklowrie

customer_reviews.title: bad quality
customer_reviews.text: the silicon band broke after 4 months and it is part of the watch so it cannot be replaced. Dealing with Garmin to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Juan D.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until the band snapped...may look into alternatives
customer_reviews.text: Love the feedback, battery life, sleekness. Don't like: digging through the menu to see the battery life (wish it was on the first menu layer as a single bar or pie chart)...and the band just broke today after 8 months and there doesn't appear to be a simple easy fix. I used to have a smart watch but didn't need the detailed display and hated recharging every night.
customer_reviews.author: Slarson

customer_reviews.title: Broadcast of HR drops
customer_reviews.text: Broadcasting the HR to my Garmin 800 did not work consistently - the Vivosmart 3 would stop broadcasting without any reason. If you paused or auto paused the 800 it would drop the HR. The Vivosmart DOES NOT have a way to broadcast the HR during an activity - in broadcast mode that is all the Vivosmart can do - if alerts come in then the HR Broadcast is terminated. So it is not useful as a real HR monitor....
customer_reviews.author: B Knapp Page

customer_reviews.title: Viewing is difficult
customer_reviews.text: Twisting wrist to view the screen is difficult, throwing arm over your head works, but who wants to look retarded? No matter how bright the screen, you cant see it outside in sunshine.... You are sacrificing function for something that looks sleek. Regret buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is awful
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 weeks. At first the battery life was fine, not anywhere near the advertised 5 days but it was ok. I went into the settings and shut everything that drains the battery off, dimmed the screen, shut off phone notifications, shut off auto track feature and heart rate monitor. It's awful to buy a product for the features and not be able to use those features. Today the battery lasted about 2 hours and was dead. It's got to go back.
customer_reviews.author: L Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice activity tracker it was between this and the fitbit ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice activity tracker it was between this and the fitbit charge 2, definitely happy i went with this over the fitbit. Garmin's are more oriented to already athletic people trying to get even better, perfect for my needs and constant want for more data.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product but great customer service
customer_reviews.text: While I was completely disappointed with this watch the customer service from the company was amazing! I got the first watch and it wouldn't hold a charge once removed from the charger. The company sent me a replacement at my request and answered my emails in less than a hour.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sampson

customer_reviews.title: 120-Day Product - That's It. WHAT A RIPOFF!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything on the Garmin Vivosmart-3 works fine, EXCEPT THE WRISTBAND. Falls apart after 4 months of wear (not strenuous wear either - just everyday wear). No way to fix it either. Because the wristband is all one piece molded rubber, when it falls apart, there is no way to fix. I wore this product, taking good care of it, for 120 days and then it fell apart. Overall rating - Features - Very Good. Product construction - CRAP!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JPH

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have just experienced two Vivosmart 3 devices that did not work. got them, charged them and neither one would work without being attached to a power source. Amazon support has been great, however, they sent me the second one (that didn't work) and now they are refunding my money.
customer_reviews.author: Goth Princess

customer_reviews.title: I owned 3.  1 lasted over a year.  2 were defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in February 2019 and it lasted until the band ripped in July 2020. That was good for the price. Bought a new one in July 2020 and it would not stay turned on without being plugged in, right out of the box after charging to "100% battery". Returned that, bought another one, same story with the battery. Garmin told me the symptom was definitely a defective product and to return them. I am done with Garmin watches for a couple years, two in a row from different suppliers is too much for me.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Good  Health monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal for someone who does alot of running or exercising as it can keep track of those activities. It appears to be fairly accurate in terms of BP and Pulse. It is by no means either a smart watch or a FitBit. It does the basics well and is considerably cheaper than either of the above.
customer_reviews.author: Coldfinger  67

customer_reviews.title: Decently-priced fitness tracker and more
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect to like it as much as I am using it now. Just needed a fitness tracker to count my steps, but I'm glad I got this. It seems to be monitoring my activities well (comparing it with my partner's Xiaomi Fit band - and the results seem close enough and can do way more). Lots of customizations on the app for your specific activities as well. Found the phone and message notifications handy, especially when away from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Roxas

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable band, hard to sync to phone
customer_reviews.text: I am still getting use to the Vivosmart 3 and have not been able to sync to my phone, I have downloaded Garmin Express to my computer but have to attach the USB cord attached to the device for it to update the results on the computer, (hassle). Do not like the rubber on the band and not able to replace band. Will have to wear it longer to determine pros - do like that I can wear it all the time and that it is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Oglesby

customer_reviews.title: Band broke in less than 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, terrible physical construction. The band breaks fast and is glued/molded to the watch, so it can't be replaced. I like the functionality and accuracy of the watch over my fitbit, but don't feel like buying a new one, so I fixed mine with a moldable thermoplastic and some replaceable bands.
customer_reviews.author: ZenOne

customer_reviews.title: Is not water proof
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it in the pool it died a sudden death. Garmin wanted to replace it eith a reconditioned one. I told them Amazin will refuns 100% of my money, so good bye!
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: I regret this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Hate hate hate this! I loved my Vivosmart HR and thought the 3would be better. Im Full of regret, terrible product. Far less comfortable. Have to tap or shake to get a back light. Only powers up or resets if you plug it in. Nothing good. I’ wish I cou,d return it! Full regrets on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wheels Mom

customer_reviews.title: A beginner feedback
customer_reviews.text: Hi, It is my first time to try an activity tracker. The design is elegant and i like to have it all the time. one disadvantage is that the device does not track swimming, you will need to insert the activity manually. i liked the application, it give good information. Regards,
customer_reviews.author: Zuhair K

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE FROM THIS SELLER!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase from this seller -- bought a garmin vivosmart 3 watch -- advertised as new --- WAS NOT NEW!! It would not turn on unless on the charger... we called Garmin and were told the watch was previously registered to a different person prior to us! Tried to return to the seller through Amazon and were told we had to pay for the shipping to return!! False advertising -- selling merchandise as new, but clearly is not. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Overkill on functions
customer_reviews.text: Would not operate once off charger even though indicated it was at 100%. Not all displays were in English. Although the watch offered many options, it appeared too confusing for my taste. A number to assist was provided but because of the unplugs of options I returned item the next day. If you’re looking for something simple I would recommend the Vivofit 3.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel S.

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a nice product but the L was too small ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a nice product but the L was too small for me. Wish they had a XL. I'm a fit 6'7" and was on the last notch on the wrist... just didn't feel right. Overall, transaction was good though
customer_reviews.author: Ben C.

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it, does what it's supposed to do ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves it, does what it's supposed to do. Not as flashy as a fitbit, but it's nicer in my opinion. AND WATERPROOF! :)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Petitjean

customer_reviews.title: Although the tracker works as advertised, it was difficult to use and poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I could only wear the Vivosmart for 48-hours. It seems that I was allergic to the plastic wrist band. I have given it to my wife who has no problem with it. It is difficult to swipe through the different trackings and to scroll through the different readouts.
customer_reviews.author: CLP

customer_reviews.title: Expect your device to die shortly after the one year warranty expires...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely, if ever, write product reviews. I'm a very passive consumer who has below average expectations for today's products. But, Garmin's fitness tracker products do not even meet my relatively low standards. My Vivosmart 3 is the 2nd Garmin fitness tracker that has died/broke shortly after the one year warranty. Tough pill to swallow for a device that costs $100+. Look elsewhere if you want a fitness tracker. I'm a casual user at best, and it has NOT held up to mild exercise and an average use of 3 weeks a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable watch.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this in stead of my old FitBit Alta because of the wider variety of notifications, and I love it. Very clean design and comfortable. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Band torn off after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Pro: - Battery life is about 7 days, not bad - Music control Cons: - Material and diamond-shape surface finish makes it easy to gather dust - Bad band quality: band torn off just a few month after buying
customer_reviews.author: Chi Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Very funtional and discrete
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Especially for its price. All the notifications I have set up on my phone go through the watch and I can even answer or decline calls (which comes in very handy for telemarketer calls). The only flaw in my opinion is that the display will not light up most times when I raise my wrist. This becomes annoying once you need to check the time but your hands are busy and cannot tap the screen. Other than this, the vivosmart3 is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Arnal

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, definitely not good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it seemed like a reasonable price and I wanted to try a fitness watch without the big financial commitment. It seemed to work alright. It was easy to set up and it tracked steps pretty accurately, but it never counted stairs correctly. Anyway, after 4 months of normal wear, it broke today. Would not recommend unless you want to replace it 3x per year.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Guynn

customer_reviews.title: Cool little device
customer_reviews.text: Syncing it to the Garmin app is a minor hassle. I removed the sync once to try to get a feature to work, and had to do a full reset on the vivosmart to get it to re-sync. The elevation feature doesn't seem to work for me. I don't care enough to notify customer service, so can't say if it's my unit or a consistent problem.
customer_reviews.author: Veritgo1

customer_reviews.title: Heart Rate Monitor is erratic.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it specifically for the heart rate feature. Sometimes it is right on, other times it’s way off. If I wear it higher up on my forearm and make it tight it is better. But comparing the reading with the two-hand double-electrodes on the new treadmill at my exercise club, it might show 110 while the treadmill shows 140. A few minutes later they might agree exactly.
customer_reviews.author: pills4

customer_reviews.title: Very good qualities and full of functionalities
customer_reviews.text: It is a small fitness band that can be customized to prevent displaying continuously the data. I use it as a band together with a watch. Very robust and full of functionalities, including continuous heart monitoring. And is produced by a great company that does not risk going out of business, like what happened with my previous fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Martins de Almeida Filho

customer_reviews.title: Former Fitbit User
customer_reviews.text: Within the last 4 years I have had 3 fitbits break, after the last one broke I decided to try the Garmin Vivosmart 3. There is a learning curve with the the touch screen and sometimes it is sensitive. The battery lasts 4 to 5 days between charges. The Garmin Connect App that you can view your information on is better than the FItbit one: it is user friendly, has good graphics and is flexible,in terms of different types of workout.
customer_reviews.author: Shanney

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit of the band, how it tells me to "move" when I've been sitting too long, and let's me know when I've met my goals for the day! I love love love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie D.

customer_reviews.title: Seller is terrible
customer_reviews.text: 2 replacement and still waiting. Still waiting on money back from original one. First was mislabeled and too small, took 3 days to get here. Second one was Dead on Arrival. Only worked when plugged in to the PC. Terrible seller. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: KateNB

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this Product.
customer_reviews.text: i tried to contact them but there was no any answer from their side. First of all, I would like to express how much im surprised of the misleading info the watch provides, when at 11 o'clock in the morning the watch shows that i climbed 11 floors while i didn't climb even one floor, the watch's readings becomes inaccurate at all ! Second of all, the watch caused cracks on the sides of my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Muhallab

customer_reviews.title: Fuzzy display
customer_reviews.text: This was for my wife, the display was very fuzzy, not sharp at all. Unfortunate because it had features she really liked. She ended up with the Fitbit Charge 2.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Make certain you take your charger with you!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fit , look and finish of this action it tracker. It does not always match the activity data that my iPhone displays at the end of a workout. The battery life needs an upgrade. When I'm away from any computers or any charging stations (in camping, exploring or some automotive activity), I've been caught with a low battery warning . I now take along a charging cell with me at all times.
customer_reviews.author: james j. roth

customer_reviews.title: Great step counting ,waterproof watch. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous product. I never have to take this off and it accurately measures all steps. It does not do as well when swimming laps but I can convert the minutes in the pool into steps with a chart. My battery life from one charge to the next has been 5 days and it lets you know when you only have 10% left. Best money I have ever spent on a product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Display Problem
customer_reviews.text: I've turned on the product for the first time and the brightness of the screen is so low that is almost impossible to read the data on it. I've tried to increase the brightness to 7 (highest possible) and I still have some problems to read the data. My husband has the same model and I can see his data clearly on the auto brightness mode. Definitely I have a problem on mine. I had the same issue with an older Vivosmart wristband. I will never buy a Garmin wristband again. I will choose Fitbit next time. They have a better reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel L.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it.! I'm not an avid athlete by any means so I do t know how accurate it is this that but it tracks sleep, stress, steps, stairs, etc... it also connects to your phone and vibrates for calls and messages. And connects to weight watchers and auto adds activity points.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Band does not last more than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Garmin Vivo smart 3 but the quality of the band is not worth it , I only had it for 6 months, not even worth to have a warranty, as stated in other reviews, if you have the warranty will be replaced but only 1X replacement allowed....so for the quality you will only get wear for a year Garmin has always been a good product, but not for this device......poor quality in the band
customer_reviews.author: doreen mcsorley

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The band broke after 6 months, no way I’ve found to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - WILL DIE WITHIN A MONTH
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend, and honestly what a terrible experience. The battery has completely ceased to charge 80% of the time, and when it does hold a charge it only lasts about half a day which is completely useless. I thought Garmin was a high-end fitness tracker brand, but apparently I would have been better off buying something from a different company. Complete waste of $80. I contacted Garmin and Amazon customer service so I will update when I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so my best guess is that im stuck with it
customer_reviews.text: Its been 8 months since I bought the product and it already tore apart and the sceeen seems to be glitched. This ocurred just now and I my activity life is that of a salesperson mainly working at offices and never engaging into tough activities or contact sports. I’m assuming the band broke because I always showered with it. Warranty is fuzzy but it does says they wont warrant any damages for misuse, so my best guess is that im stuck with it. Never buying garmin again.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Sarabia

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It tracks your steps, your stair climbs, your heart rate, and a bunch of other things. Although I wouldn't trust it to track your sleep. It said I got 3 hours of REM sleep while I was at work one day. I don't think that happened. Other than that, it's a great product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... have had this watch for several weeks and really like it, It keeps track of your pulse and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch for several weeks and really like it, It keeps track of your pulse and keeps count of your steps.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shiretzki

customer_reviews.title: Could use improvement
customer_reviews.text: Many features but not easy to figure out how to get to them on the Garmin VivoSmart. The display screen has all pictures and no words. The date doesn't display on this model. I miss that. I wish there was a changeable band as this one is very uncomfortable when using the computer mouse. The clasp hits a tender spot on my wrist. On the good side, I love that it has the heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: lynette

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend as a simple no hassle heart-rate and exercise tracker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, easy to use, accurate HR measuring. Battery lasts roughly 6-7 days for me. However, I have it set to receive a lot of notifications. If you aren't used to wearing a watch or other fitness wearable the strap can irritate your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Face is easily scratched
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to read. The screen is faint and turns off quickly. You always must swipe it and then it gets scratched looking. This was an issue after only a couple of weeks. This was my husband's. I will try a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Peg Joachim

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but a great item for the price coupled ...
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect, but a great item for the price coupled with an actively maintained app. I would recommend Garmin over the overly popular FitBits of the world any day.
customer_reviews.author: ActiveB1t

customer_reviews.title: Died after theee months!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this! It lasted three months and won’t turn on anymore. I can’t get them to respond. Too bad, I loved the interface.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: disappointed in garmin
customer_reviews.text: very disappoined in this model. Had a Garmin previously which was terrific, for 3 years. Had trouble sincing tjis one to my smart phone, took couple of hours and battery doesn't last as long as should. plus as a senior this is not a good choice . just disappointed in Garmin for this product.
customer_reviews.author: GLYNNIE LASLOVICH

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof wins!
customer_reviews.text: It was between this one and the fit bit model. This one won and I'm glad it did. It's waterproof and that's what you need, not some band you have to keep taking off near water.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Pace

customer_reviews.title: Won't pair with my phone.
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I try will not pair with my phone. I've called Motorola, they couldn't help and called my phone carrier...neither could help. I'll have to wait to call Garmin during the week when they're open.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Corriher

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out after six months use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for six months and now it is malfunctioning out of nowhere. It barely responds and lags incredibly when it does feel like working. Trying to decide if I want to bother getting another or not. I loved it when it worked.. but, wow.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Would not give a full return on damaged watch.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the garmin watch as a Christmas present. It did not work, since I didn't report the non working new garmin within 24 hours I was only refunded 28.80 instead of the 63.11 I spent. I would have been okay with the 57$ before the tax. I also purchased the warranty which was no use at all! Looks like I need to stick with purchasing from garmin directly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R.

customer_reviews.title: unable to change time
customer_reviews.text: Unable to change time due to Daylight savings time. Unable to return, since there is no longer option for returning. Last day allowed to return was before Daylight savings time, so wasn't aware of the issue. I don't have a smart phone, so can't change the time. It doesn't seem to work on my iPad, so the watch is useless to me at this time. Is there any way to return this item?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Band is made of a low quality material and it isn't replaceable
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months using the watch, the band began to unglue, after 10 months it has broken. Problem is that the band is NOT replaceable, so, now I have a perfectly functional smartwach that I can't wear. Besides, the lack of integration and compatibility with others apps, and even google fit, limits the usage.
customer_reviews.author: Luiz de Lima Souza

customer_reviews.title: East to use
customer_reviews.text: Great way to motivate you to move, shows your step, heart rate, time, date and others. Makes it fun to try and beat your best days.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Turner

customer_reviews.title: I can say this is an excellent progression. i don't need GPS
customer_reviews.text: Having owned a vivosmart HR +, I can say this is an excellent progression. i don't need GPS. I do need a dependable and nice looking, waterproof device. Nice going, Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Schwartzy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Could not the the display to light from wrist movement. Return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my son so his soccer coaches and trainers ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son so his soccer coaches and trainers could monitor and evaluate his conditioning and estimate his time of play and level of work rate will on the field.
customer_reviews.author: UFG8rs

customer_reviews.title: Regrettably, I had to return it because I could ...
customer_reviews.text: Regrettably, I had to return it because I could not connect it to the Garmin app on my phone. The text on the Garmin seemed to be in a foreign language, and I was unable to reach the set-up window to change language. My very computer literate son-in-law, very computer literate grandson and I (reasonably computer literate) all failed.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Block

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: On a health thing and this helps me achieve my goals. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: FERJOS

customer_reviews.title: Didnt even last 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday and was excited about trying a Garmin fitness tracker. Got it all set up and working the day I got it. By noon the following day the screen wouldn't wake up. Just spent a hour on phone with Garmin support and nothing the techs comment was "interesting" and said I was probably best off returning where I bought it as it would be much faster. Back to fitbit I guess. Very disappointing Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Contractor4

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery
customer_reviews.text: Broken when received. Watch would not work when disconnected from charger.
customer_reviews.author: hanner73

customer_reviews.title: ... been using this for over a month and really like it. I got a size a little larger ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for over a month and really like it. I got a size a little larger so that I can wear it a little higher during roller derby practice and still track my work out there. I tried the weight lifting function and I don't like that you have to confirm each set of reps. I do a lot of HIIT workouts where I'm moving quickly through different lifts/etc for time and stopping to click through is a lil cumbersome. Like the app and how it syncs to myfitness pal.
customer_reviews.author: lacy kilty

customer_reviews.title: the best out there
customer_reviews.text: very solid construction, water proof. a lot better than fitbit, went through 2 of them, most likely be cause they were not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Happy with HR tracking function
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this primarily to monitor heart rate and it does a good job. Slowly starting to use some of the other tracking functions and the ones I have used appear to be reasonably accurate. Battery lasts 4-5 days but I don't know exactly how long it would last for me as I recharge it on a regular basis before it is fully discharged.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: The waterproof fitness tracker you have been looking for! Band has a tendency to come loose, so make sure it is secure.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't compare with the Fitbit I had previously. Hard to set up. Very sporadic syncing. Accuracy of heart rate monitor is not good.. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Craiger

customer_reviews.title: cheap band - broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Like the features, hate the band, this is my second one and the rubber comes apart after about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Battery now dies within hours
customer_reviews.text: After four months Vivosmart 3 battery needed to be charged twice a day just to make it through the day. It is not Not feasible to own this device any longer.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work. I’be had two of these, and it’s a great product. However this one is not working. It does not keep time. The heart rate monitor does not work and the battery is defective. It only works when connected to the charger. Item was listed as brand new, but there were clear indications that it was previously used.
customer_reviews.author: Ivans Duval

product_meta.title: Garmin vivosmart 3 - Black, L
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:LFeaturing a sleek design and a hidden display that’s only on when you need it, vívosmart 3 tracks steps, floors climbed, sleep and so much more. It tracks your fitness and wellness with all-day HR and Stress monitoring, VO2 Max and Fitness Age. With Move IQ and a new Strength Training activity which automatically counts your weight training reps, working out will be convenient and effective. The device updates the time and date when you synchronize your device to a computer or mobile device. You should synchronize your device to receive the correct time when you change time zones, and to update for daylight saving time
feature_bullets: The thinnest HR-equipped activity tracker from Garmin at 4mm thinner and more form fitting than vívosmart HR. Physical size: Width: 0.7 inches, Length (large): 8.77 inches, Circumference (large): 5.8-8.5 inches
While not in use, the discreet display disappears into the device so as not to overshadow your style
Measures VO2 Max, which is widely recognized as an excellent mearure
Stress monitoring enables users to see periods of elevated stress or restful recovery
New strength training activity will count sets, reps, and rest times and will push them to Garmin Connect for review

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars901 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
